name: Hari Krishna Kosana
professional_summary: Managed full-stack application modernizations to Azure for Hospitality platforms, applying .NET/C# and ASP.NET Core to transition legacy systems and boost booking engine performance while aligning with PCI-DSS standards.

Assembled secure patient data portals for Healthcare using Angular and Azure SQL Database, configured HIPAA-compliant encryption and Azure Key Vault integrations to protect sensitive medical records during system migrations.

Governed Transportation logistics APIs with React frontends and Azure Functions, transformed monolithic cargo tracking applications into microservices that improved real-time flight schedule updates for operational teams.

Produced Government public service web applications via ASP.NET Core, deployed with Azure App Service and ARM Templates to create scalable portals for citizen benefit claims processing under strict regulatory audits.

Guided Banking financial data pipelines toward Azure cloud, utilized Azure DevOps Pipelines and Terraform to automate deployments for transactional systems, reinforcing SOX compliance and fraud detection mechanisms.

Operationalized Telecommunications billing system upgrades with .NET frameworks, integrated RESTful APIs and SQL Server to streamline customer invoice generation and reduce monthly statement processing errors.

Synthesized cloud architecture for Hospitality loyalty programs, applied Azure Monitor and Application Insights to detect booking funnel drop-offs, which led to targeted UI corrections and increased conversion rates.

Directed Healthcare imaging data workflows with Azure Logic Apps, established automated processing pipelines for diagnostic reports that reduced radiologist manual entry tasks and accelerated patient report delivery.

Mobilized Transportation crew management tools with C# and Docker, containerized legacy .NET applications for consistent deployment across airport hubs, ensuring reliable shift scheduling for ground staff.

Restructured Government document archive systems using Azure SQL Database, authored stored procedures and LINQ queries to optimize retrieval times for public records requested through Freedom of Information Act queries.

Enforced Banking authentication protocols with Azure AD B2C, implemented multi-factor authentication flows for online banking portals, which substantially lowered incidents of unauthorized account access attempts.

Transitioned Telecommunications network monitoring dashboards to Azure, leveraged Azure Kubernetes Service to orchestrate containerized .NET microservices, providing real-time visibility into cellular tower performance.

Arranged Hospitality revenue analytics using Azure Synapse Analytics, constructed data models to analyze seasonal booking patterns, enabling dynamic pricing strategies for hotel partners to maximize occupancy.

Steered Healthcare telehealth platform integrations, connected React-based patient interfaces with backend .NET APIs, facilitating secure video consultations and electronic prescription renewals for remote clinics.

Modernized Transportation baggage handling system APIs, converted WCF services to ASP.NET Core Web APIs with Azure API Management, improving message reliability and tracking accuracy for passenger luggage.
Administered Government grant application portals, set up automated approval workflows with Azure Functions and Logic Apps, reducing manual review cycles for small business funding requests.

Strengthened Banking data encryption standards, configured Transparent Data Encryption on Azure SQL Databases and rotated keys via Key Vault, meeting internal security policies for customer financial information.

Automated Telecommunications customer onboarding processes, designed and deployed Azure DevOps Pipelines with infrastructure-as-code using Terraform, which accelerated provisioning of new subscriber accounts.

responsibilities: Maintain a multi-tenant hotel reservation platform using ASP.NET Core and React, upgrade legacy modules to integrate with new Azure App Service instances for improved scalability during peak booking seasons.
Created a real-time room availability service with Azure Functions and Cosmos DB, solved latency issues that previously caused double-bookings for hospitality partners across different time zones.

Fabricated Infrastructure-as-Code templates with Terraform to provision Azure SQL Database and App Service environments, automated the setup of new client onboarding pipelines for franchise hotel groups.
Structured a comprehensive CI/CD pipeline in Azure DevOps that compiles, tests, and deploys microservices; this process reduced manual deployment errors for critical payment processing components.
Verified all API endpoints with xUnit and integration tests, focused on booking transaction flows to ensure data consistency and compliance with regional hospitality tax calculation rules.

Delivered containerized versions of legacy services using Docker, deployed them to Azure Kubernetes Service to achieve better resource utilization and faster rollback capabilities for front-desk applications.
Architected a centralized logging solution with Application Insights and Azure Monitor, correlated errors across services to diagnose a recurring issue with loyalty point redemption during checkout.
Resolved a critical production bug where promotional codes failed, traced the problem to a race condition in the Redis cache layer and implemented a distributed lock pattern to fix it.
Reviewed pull requests daily for the frontend React team, provided feedback on state management hooks and component structure to align with the design system for guest-facing booking pages.

Coordinated with the security team to integrate Azure Key Vault for managing database connection strings and API keys, removing hard-coded secrets from the configuration files of the reservation system.
Attended bi-weekly sprint planning sessions with product managers, broke down user stories for new features like dynamic pricing and group booking capabilities into actionable technical tasks.
Trained two junior developers on the codebase, walked them through the domain model for room inventory and rate management, and paired with them to debug their first feature submissions.
Initiated a performance optimization effort for the search results page, identified and indexed slow SQL queries on the Azure SQL Database, which cut page load time for guests by half.
Evaluated the adoption of Azure AD B2C for a unified guest authentication system, presented a proof-of-concept to leadership comparing it with the existing custom identity solution.
Documented the deployment runbooks and disaster recovery procedures for the cloud infrastructure, focusing on the high-availability setup of the booking engine across Azure regions.

Adapted the application's data handling processes to align with GDPR requirements for European guests, implemented data anonymization routines and user consent logging in the customer profile service.
Built a patient portal module with Angular and .NET 6 Web API, enabled secure access to lab results and appointment scheduling while enforcing strict HIPAA-compliant audit trails.
Migrated an on-premise SQL Server database for clinical trial management to Azure SQL Database, executed a detailed data validation plan to ensure zero loss of sensitive patient cohort information.

Applied Azure Logic Apps to automate the generation and secure delivery of patient discharge summaries, connected disparate hospital systems to reduce nurse administrative workload by several hours weekly.

Designed a set of RESTful APIs for medical imaging metadata, utilized Entity Framework Core and LINQ for efficient querying, which accelerated radiologist search times within the picture archiving system.
Formulated a unit and integration test suite with NUnit and Moq for critical patient identity management services, achieved target code coverage to satisfy internal healthcare software quality gates.
Planned and executed the blue-green deployment of a telehealth application using Azure App Service slots, minimized downtime during the rollout of a new video consultation feature for cardiology.
Inspected application performance using Application Insights, pinpointed memory leaks in a long-running service that processed HL7 messages and refactored the code to stabilize the service.
Composed Infrastructure-as-Code scripts with ARM Templates to replicate the non-production Azure environments, ensured the development and QA teams had consistent setups for testing new features.
Audited the authentication flow for the staff intranet application, integrated Azure AD B2C to unify login processes across various internal tools used by doctors and administrative personnel.

Organized weekly knowledge-sharing sessions with the development team, covered topics like dependency injection in ASP.NET Core and secure coding practices for handling Protected Health Information (PHI).
Debugged a complex issue where appointment reminders failed sporadically, discovered a misconfigured timeout in the Azure Function trigger and adjusted the configuration to resolve it.
Tested the data encryption implementation for patient records at rest in Azure SQL, collaborated with the compliance team to validate that the setup met all necessary FDA and HIPAA regulations.
Enhanced the search functionality of the patient directory, implemented full-text search capabilities which allowed clinical staff to find patient records faster during emergency situations.
Deployed a monitoring dashboard using Azure Monitor workbooks, configured alerts for key metrics of the appointment management system to proactively address potential service degradation.
Developed a flight crew scheduling application with ASP.NET Core MVC and React, streamlined the assignment process for pilots and flight attendants, considering union rules and FAA rest regulations.

Converted a monolithic baggage tracking system into a set of microservices hosted on Azure App Service, improved the reliability of real-time luggage location updates for airport customer service agents.
Established an Azure DevOps release pipeline that deployed containerized .NET APIs to Azure Kubernetes Service, automated the canary release process for the inflight entertainment management service.
Programmed Azure Functions to handle event-driven notifications for flight status changes, integrated with Service Bus to alert operational control centers about delays and gate changes.
Examined performance bottlenecks in the cargo manifest API, optimized SQL queries and introduced Redis caching for frequently accessed flight load data, which reduced response times significantly.
Installed Application Insights across all backend services, set up custom telemetry to track the performance of the revenue management system during high-demand holiday booking periods.
Protected passenger Personally Identifiable Information (PII) within the mileage account system, implemented data masking in logs and utilized Azure Key Vault for all credential management.
Compiled technical documentation for the flight operations API suite, created runbooks for the support team to handle common incidents like integration failures with airport systems.
Troubleshot a production outage in the check-in kiosk backend, identified a network ACL misconfiguration in the Azure environment that blocked communication and restored service within the SLA.
Updated the legacy .NET Framework components of the employee travel benefits portal to .NET 6, resolved compatibility issues with modern authentication libraries and third-party travel APIs.
Validated the disaster recovery failover procedure for the booking engine database, participated in a scheduled drill to switch over to the Azure SQL geo-replicated secondary region.
Assisted the QA team in automating regression tests for the booking flow, provided them with Postman collections and example payloads to simulate complex multi-city international itineraries.
Engineered a web-based system for unemployment claim processing using ASP.NET Web API and Angular, enabled citizens to submit claims and track status online, reducing call center volume.

Integrated the benefits application with legacy mainframe systems via IBM MQ, built a reliable messaging layer in C# that ensured data consistency between modern web interfaces and older COBOL systems.
Configured Azure App Service plans and Auto-scaling rules for the public portal, handled predictable traffic surges during weekly claim filing deadlines without performance degradation.
Authored detailed unit tests with MSTest for core business logic modules, focused on complex eligibility calculation rules dictated by state government legislation and policy updates.
Orchestrated the database migration from an on-premise SQL Server 2012 cluster to Azure SQL Database, performed extensive data cleansing to align with new application data models.
Monitored application health with Azure Monitor and Log Analytics, created alert rules for error rates and response times to ensure high availability for this critical public service.
Defined API security standards using OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect, implemented token-based authentication to secure citizen data as mandated by the state's IT security office.
Refactored several legacy Web Forms pages into modern Razor Pages within the ASP.NET Core application, improved maintainability and page load performance for internal agency users.
Investigated a data discrepancy reported by auditors, traced it to a timezone conversion bug in a batch job and corrected the logic to ensure accurate reporting for federal compliance.
Participated in daily stand-ups and sprint retrospectives, provided estimates for implementing new features like document upload and digital signature capture for claim forms.
Constructed internal tools for loan origination using .NET Framework 4.7 and WPF, automated data validation steps which shortened the processing time for mortgage applications.
Incorporated SOAP-based web services from third-party credit bureaus into the application workflow, handled secure transmission and parsing of XML responses to populate applicant credit reports.
Deployed application updates to on-premise IIS servers using PowerShell scripts, coordinated with the infrastructure team during maintenance windows to minimize disruption for loan officers.
Analyzed stored procedures in SQL Server 2016 to fix performance issues in the customer search functionality, added missing indexes that improved query speed for high-volume branches.
Checked code submissions for adherence to internal security standards, focused on preventing SQL injection and cross-site scripting vulnerabilities in ASP.NET MVC customer portals.
Prepared technical design documents for a new module to calculate adjustable-rate mortgage (ARM) terms, diagrammed the class relationships and sequence of operations for review by the architect.
Supported the production environment by being on-call, diagnosed and fixed a bug where interest rate updates from a feed service were not being reflected correctly in the user interface.
Learned about the bank's strict change management and SOX compliance procedures, followed all required steps for code promotion from development through to production deployment.
Implemented features for a customer care desktop application using WinForms and .NET 4.5, focused on modules for managing prepaid mobile plan upgrades and handling service complaints.
Connected to Oracle databases using ADO.NET, wrote optimized queries to retrieve subscriber call detail records for billing dispute resolution by customer service representatives.
Fixed bugs reported by the UAT team, such as incorrect data display in the customer profile screen and navigation errors between different forms of the legacy application.
Performed routine builds of the application using Team Foundation Server, resolved merge conflicts and ensured the code compiled successfully for the nightly integration tests.
Attended requirements gathering meetings with business analysts, helped clarify technical feasibility for new features like bulk SIM card activation for corporate accounts.
Studied the existing three-tier architecture of the billing system, began working on a new Web API prototype to eventually replace parts of the older Windows Communication Foundation services.
